p:
We identified one study assessing the association between DBS outcome and common low-risk variants from GWAS.
71 Eighty-five patients who underwent STN-DBS were genotyped for single-nucleotide polymorphisms in the SNCA (rs356220) and LRRK2 (rs1491923) loci. Treatment response was measured as difference in UPDRS III in the stimulation on/medication off-state two years postoperatively versus medication off before surgery. The risk-allele of the SNCA variant rs356220 was weakly associated with UPDRS III improvement at p = 0.03, but not with baseline scores, indicating that the variant could be a prognostic marker for DBS outcome. No association was seen for the LRRK2 variant.
